intro: Coccocypselum hirsutum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves, which are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often white or pale pink, adding ornamental value to the plant. It is often found in coastal or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in well-drained environments.
